definition: gun/firearm/rifle/spear/thing with shape or function similar to a gun/CL:支[zhi1],把[ba3],桿|杆[gan3],條|条[tiao2],枝[zhi1]/to substitute for another person in a test/to knock/classifier for rifle shots

sentences.english: The gunshot wound to Lien Chan's son's right temple is not believed to be life-threatening, the report said.
sentences.chinese: 報道說，連戰兒子右太陽穴的槍傷並不威脅生命。

sentences.english: He confirmed that Col Gaddafi had been taken alive, but died of bullet wounds minutes before reaching hospital.
sentences.chinese: 他絕對卡扎菲是被活捉，在送往醫院錢死於子彈槍傷。

sentences.english: Tolling, or luring, is the practice of tricking ducks into gunshot range.
sentences.chinese: 收費，或引誘，是欺騙槍傷鴨子範圍的做法。

sentences.english: Despite suffering a second and fatal wound, Staff Sgt. Miller remained steadfast and continued his selfless acts of heroism.
sentences.chinese: 儘管遭到致命的槍傷，米勒上士依然堅定英勇地作戰。

sentences.english: The man Paiko had stepped on was bleeding from a bullet wound.
sentences.chinese: 派克剛剛踩到的人身上有個槍傷，傷口正在流血。

sentences.english: He has a bullet wound in the left breast.

definition: to wound with a blade or hatchet/to slash/to gash
to meet violent death/to get killed
locked in (with the door locked from the outside)
to shoot with a gun/shooting incident
